required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Planning Message Recommending Same Time/Location as Last Vaccine
clinical_study.official_title: Planning Message Recommending Same Time/Location as Last Vaccine

brief_summary.textblock: This experiment is part of a megastudy with a total of ten experimental conditions and a holdout control condition to which patients will be randomly assigned. The focal comparison in this experiment is between a message suggesting the same day of the week, at the same time of day, and at the same pharmacy location as their last vaccination and a control message telling patients that an updated COVID booster vaccine is waiting for them. The intervention testing if text messages encouraging vaccination by suggesting patients receive a shot on the same day of the week, at the same time of day, and at the same pharmacy location as their last vaccination will produce more vaccinations than otherwise identical messages.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants will be randomly assigned to the different arms.
study_design_info.masking_description: As treated participants will receive text messages, there is no scope for blinding. Care providers will not be made aware of subjects' participation in the study, or assigned treatment arms. The study team will only receive data on subjects' assigned arms and outcomes at the end of the study.

primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 30 days after receiving the SMS/MMS intervention
primary_outcome.description: Whether patients receive a bivalent COVID booster at the pharmacy in question

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 60 days after receiving the SMS/MMS intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Whether patients receive a bivalent COVID booster at the pharmacy in question

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 90 days after receiving the SMS/MMS intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Whether patients receive a bivalent COVID booster at the pharmacy in question

arm_group.arm_group_label: Control condition with "waiting for you" message
arm_group.description: This control condition will use the text message that the investigators found to be the best performing in their last mega-study of vaccine text messages to recommend a COVID vaccination.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Planning message recommending same time/location as last vaccination
arm_group.description: This condition will use a text message recommending the same time and location as the participant's last vaccination to get a COVID vaccination.

intervention.description: Participants will receive text messages per descriptions listed in the arms.
intervention.arm_group_label: Control condition with "waiting for you" message
Planning message recommending same time/location as last vaccination

criteria.textblock:
Exclusion Criteria:
1. The patient unsubscribed from texts before the send date and time of the patient's SMS/MMS message
2. The patient received a bivalent COVID booster before the send date and time of the patient's SMS/MMS message.
